sentences: Lapsed ei räägi tavalistesti nii palju.
context: The word 'räägib' is the 3rd person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'rääkima', which means 'to speak' or 'to talk'. It describes someone who is currently speaking or talking. The base form 'rääkima' can be conjugated into different tenses and forms: räägin (I speak), räägid (you speak), räägib (he/she/it speaks), räägime (we speak), räägite (you plural speak), räägivad (they speak).
